abstract: Big 12 formally announces that West Virginia will become a member of the league; West Virginia president James P Clements indicates that negotiations are under way with the Big East on how the university can leave after 2011.
snippet: The move ended two days of uncertainty in which West Virginia’s invitation to the Big 12 was pulled back and Louisville emerged as a possible replacement.
lead_paragraph: The move ended two days of uncertainty in which West Virginia’s invitation to the Big 12 was pulled back and Louisville emerged as a possible replacement.

headline.main: West Virginia Wants Out, but Big East Won’t Let Go
headline.print_headline: W. Virginia Set to Exit; Big East Won’t Let Go
headline.seo: West Virginia to Leave Big East, but When Remains Issue
